ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Renaissance education Society is an organization who works for the upliftment of the poor, needy and weaker section of the society. Our society believes in the hard work and dedication .Spreading education and awareness among the people of the society. 1. Bridge Course Program- The society has been running bridge course for poor deprived and slum children, who are not able to go to school and get primary education. The society made time to time survey and collects children and taught them in our center. After few months we take them to nearby Govt. School to register their name in school for the regular basis. 2. Beautician Course- The society runs beautician course for the unprivileged women for their betterment at the center. Our objective is to give them confidence and self employed to raise income for their family. 3. Cutting and Tailoring Center â€“ Our society is running cutting and tailoring center at Vasundhra (NCR) for poor and needy women. The aim of these trainings is to make these trainers capable to earn something for their family. 4. Child Development Program- The society has been conducted programs, under this project. Our aim is to aware people about their right, child labour and child development. 5. Social Awareness Camp- The society has set up social awareness camp at Sonia Vihar(Vth Pusta). We specialize the point of girl child birth, abortion, girl education and make them realize that, girls are not tension; they are now equal to ten sons. 6. Food Processing Course- The society has set up Food Processing center at Sonia Vihar. The purpose of this center is to utilize the leisure hour for productive purpose. The aim of the training is to make women self-employed. 7. Environment & Disaster Management Awareness Program- The society has organized environmental awareness camp, where we give the knowledge of global warming and their effect on nature. We asked them to ban polybag and use jute and paper bags. The society has organized camp and mock drill practice to aware people regarding the disaster made by human and nature. How to save people lives. What kind of first aid can be used to help people against disasters like flood, earthquake, bomb blast, terrorism etc. 8. Self Help Group- The society runs self help group program. Under this we can help women in monetary matter, providing financial help. 9. Yoga And Meditation â€“ The society has set up Yoga and Meditation Camp at center to aware people about the importance of yoga and meditation. 10. Computer Literacy Program- The society is running computer center at Vasundhra branch. We can give basic knowledge of computer to understand the modern and digital world. A we all know computer is necessary in every field. 11.Health And Drug Prevention Program- The society has set up health camp to aware people of their health and hygiene with routine check-up. The society arranges counselor to explain the ill effects of use of alcohol and drugs, alongwith counseling on aids, cancer and polio.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Members contribute towards the organisation as no funds are received. Also after the patients treatment they give some amount to the organisation. Most of the members also do not give funds to the organisation

ngoList.title: Roshni
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Roshni is a social enterprise dedicated to alleviating poverty in India by empowering girls to realize their highest potential.Our mission is to empower a new generation of economically self sufficient and socially responsible women who will uplift their families out of poverty and who will catalyze the economic and social progress of the nation as a whole.Roshni works in partnership with various schools in Delhi and Uttar Pradesh to conduct its training programs and empowers underprivileged girls through Employability and Life Skills Trainings. Founded in 2008 by Ms. Saima Hasan, Roshni has trained over 10,000 girls and empowered over 50,000 family and community members. Over 90% of Roshni alumni have broken the cycle of poverty and are pursuing higher education along with part time employment while others have been awarded academic scholarships through Roshni.

members.name: Ms Gagan Makar Singh Gagan Singh

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Salaam Baalak Trust has completed twenty five years of service to street children in Delhi. From 3 staff and 25 children on a balcony of the Ground Reserve Police at the New Delhi Railway station, we have now grown to over 150 staff, providing support services in Delhi & the NCR region through our 24centres- including five shelter homes, and 17 day centres. In the year 2013-14, we have been able to touch and care for 6203 vulnerable children. The children have blossomed into fine young adults. Our children are our pride... our inspiration. Our children have been our inspiration. With the dedicated efforts of the staff, we have successfully given street children an opportunity to realise their dreams of a secure and happy life. We have 2 boys who are successful engineers, 3 who have completed their Masters in Arts program, 5 who have won scholarships for advanced programs to American Universities, 16 in an Australian affiliated University and many more who are pursuing their academic career in school and colleges across India. Our young people have become successful photographers, choreographers, actors, dancers, writers and film makers as well as work in corporate houses including, Coca Cola, Pizza Hut, DSC and media houses like Midi Tech and Teamwork. Chota Salim starred in the Oscar nominated short film â€“ Little Terrorist.Vicky was among four young photographers to collate the re-building of World Trade Centre. Children who have grown up in the SBT family are our best ambassadors. Some of helped their families back home- building houses for their parents, educating younger siblings, arranging for marriages of their sisters. Some have found life partners and settled into happy matrimony. Many have donated back to the Trust and support skill building of younger children.
